Levels 1-4.event: The partially eaten carcass of a mammoth, from which 1d4 weeks of rations can be harvested
Single-file tracks in the snow that stop abruptly
A frozen pond with a jagged hole in the ice that appears recently made

Levels 1-4.monsters: orc Eye of Gruumsh with 2d8 orcs

Levels 5-10.event: A half-orc druid tending to an injured polar bear. If the characters assist the druid, she gives them a vial of antitoxin.

Levels 5-10.monsters: zombies aboard a galleon trapped in the ice. Searching the ship yields 2d20 days of rations.
bandit captain with 1 druid, 1d3 berserkers, and 2d10 + 5 bandits
hours of extreme cold (see chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide)
orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d6 orogs and 2d8 + 6 orcs

Levels 5-10.event: A howl that echoes over the land for 1d3 minutes

Levels 11-16.event: A blizzard that reduces visibility to 5 feet for 1d6 hours
A herd of 3d20 + 60 caribou (deer) moving through the snow
A mile-wide frozen lake in which the preserved corpses of strange creatures can be seen
A crumbling ice castle littered with the frozen bodies of blue-skinned humanoids

Levels 17-20.event: A circular patch of black ice on the ground. The air temperature around the patch is warmer than in the surrounding area, and characters who inspect the ice find bits of machinery frozen within.
An adventurer frozen 6 feet under the ice; 50% chance the corpse has a rare magic item of the DM’s choice
A 500-foot-high wall of ice that is 300 feet thick and spread across 1d4 miles
The likeness of a stern woman with long, flowing hair, carved into the side of a mountain

Levels 17-20.monsters: ancient white dragon with 1d3 young white dragons

Levels 1-4.monsters: ghouls feeding on corpses aboard the wreckage of a merchant ship. A search uncovers 2d6 bolts of ruined silk, a 50-foot length of rope, and a barrel of salted herring.

Levels 1-4.event: A few dozen baby turtles struggling to make their way to the sea
A momentary formation in the waves that looks like an enormous humanoid face
A lone hermit (acolyte) sitting on the beach, contemplating the meaning of the multiverse

Levels 1-4.monsters: sahuagin priestess with 1d3 merrow and 2d6 sahuagin

Levels 5-10.event: A pseudodragon chasing gulls through the air

Levels 5-10.monsters: commoner singing a dirge (day only) or 1 banshee (night only)

Levels 5-10.event: A stoppered bottle containing an illegible note and half buried in the sand
A battle at sea between two galleons
A pirate crew consisting of 1 bandit captain, 1 druid, 2 berserkers, and 2d12 bandits, all searching for buried treasure
A severed humanoid hand tangled in a net

Levels 5-10.monsters: sahuagin baron with 1d3 sahuagin priestesses and 2d8 sahuagin

Levels 11-16.event: A nest of 1d6 dragon turtle eggs
A trident partially buried in the sand

Levels 11-16.monsters: ghasts crawling over 1d6 wrecked ships and feeding on the dead

Levels 11-16.event: A beached whale, dead and bloated. If it takes any damage, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Levels 17-20.event: An adult bronze dragon fighting an adult blue dragon to the death

Levels 17-20.monsters: adult bronze dragon or 1 adult blue dragon
waterspouts that dance on the water before stopping abruptly

Levels 1-4.monsters: commoners with 2d4 camels bound for a distant city
guards escorting a noble to the edge of the desert, all of them astride camels

Levels 1-4.event: Single-file tracks marching deeper into the desert
An oasis surrounded by palm trees and containing the remnants of an old camp
A brass lamp lying on the ground

Levels 1-4.monsters: gnoll pack lord with 1d3 giant hyenas

Levels 1-4.event: A pile of humanoid bones wrapped in rotting cloth

Levels 1-4.monsters: bandit captain with 1 druid and 3d6 bandits

Levels 5-10.event: A stone obelisk partly buried in the sand
A meteorite resting at the bottom of a glassy crater

Levels 5-10.monsters: bandit captain with 1d3 berserkers and 3d6 bandits

Levels 5-10.event: Strong winds that kick up dust and reduce visibility to 1d6 feet for 1d4 hours

Levels 11-16.event: A desert caravan consisting of 1d6 merchants (nobles) with 2d6 guards
A plundered pyramid

Levels 17-20.monsters: yuan-ti abominations with 2d10 + 5 yuan-ti malisons and 4d6 + 6 yuan-ti purebloods

Levels 17-20.event: An abandoned city made from white marble, empty during the day. At night, harmless apparitions roam the streets, replaying the final moments of their lives.

Levels 17-20.monsters: hours of extreme heat (see chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide)

Levels 17-20.event: An old signpost identifying a single destination, called Pazar

Levels 1-4.event: A lost, weeping child. If the characters take the child home, the parents reward them with 1d3 potions of healing.
A young woodcutter (scout) racing through the forest to rescue a lost friend

Levels 1-4.monsters: swarm of insects or 2d8 blood hawks

Levels 1-4.event: A stream of cool, clean water flowing between the trees

Levels 1-4.monsters: web cocoons hanging from the branches, holding withered carcasses
orc Eye of Gruumsh with 2d4 + 2 orcs
gnoll pack lord with 1d4 giant hyenas
lizardfolk shaman with 1d3 swarms of poisonous snakes and 1d10 + 2 lizardfolk
hobgoblin captain with 2d6 hobgoblins and 1d4 giant boars

Levels 5-10.monsters: orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d3 orogs and 1d8 + 2 orcs

Levels 5-10.event: A small shack almost hidden by the deep forest. The interior is empty aside from a large cast-iron oven.

Levels 5-10.monsters: gnoll pack lord with 1d4 + 1 giant hyenas

Levels 5-10.event: An old stone archway of obvious elven design. Any character who passes under it makes Wisdom (Perception) checks with advantage for 1 hour.

Levels 5-10.monsters: bandit captain with 1 druid and 1d6 + 5 bandits

Levels 5-10.event: A clear pool of water with 1d6 sleeping animals lying around its edge
An old tree with a wizened face carved into the trunk

Levels 5-10.monsters: hobgoblin captain with 3d10 hobgoblins and 4d12 goblins

Levels 11-16.monsters: druids performing a ritual for the dead (day only) or 1d4 banshees (night only)
gnoll fangs of Yeenoghu with 2d6 + 3 gnolls

Levels 11-16.event: A pool of clear, still water. Gold coins litter the bottom, but they disappear if removed from the pool.
A small woodland shrine dedicated to a mysterious cult named the Siswa
A group of seven people (commoners) wearing animal masks and ambling through the woods
Peals of silvery laughter that echo from a distance

Levels 17-20.event: For a few hundred feet, wherever the characters step, flowers bloom and emit soft light.

Levels 17-20.monsters: elves living in a small community in the treetops

Levels 17-20.event: A 50-foot-tall stone statue of an elf warrior with hand raised, palm out, as if to forbid travelers from coming this way
A cairn set atop a low hill

Levels 1-5.event: A circle of standing stones within which the air is utterly still, no matter how hard the wind blows outside

Levels 1-5.monsters: gnoll pack lord with 1d4 giant hyenas
giant wasps or 1d4 + 3 swarms of insects
giant wolf spiders or 1 giant eagle
giant elk, or 1 gnoll pack lord with 1d3 giant hyenas
goblin boss with 1d6 + 2 goblins and 1d4 + 3 wolves, or 1d3 thri-kreen
gnoll fangs of Yeenoghu, or 1 orc Eye of Gruumsh with 2d4 + 1 orcs

Levels 6-10.event: A tornado that touches down 1d6 miles away, tearing up the land for 1 mile before it dissipates
A stretch of land littered with rotting war machines, bones, and banners of forgotten armies

Levels 6-10.monsters: gnoll pack lord with 1d4 + 1 giant hyenas
orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d8 + 1 orcs

Levels 6-10.event: A hot wind that carries the stench of rot
A tribe of 2d20 + 20 nomads (tribal warriors) on riding horses following a herd of antelope (deer). The nomads are willing to trade food, leather, and information for weapons.

Levels 11-16.event: An old road of paved stones, partly reclaimed by wilderness, that travels for 1d8 miles in either direction before ending
A witch (mage) dwelling in a crude hut. She offers potions of healing, antitoxins, and other consumable items for sale in exchange for food and news.
A giant hole 50 feet across that descends nearly 500 feet before opening into an empty cave
A circular section of grass nearly a quarter-mile across that appears to have been pressed down; 1d4 more such circles connected by lines can be seen from overhead.

Levels 17-20.monsters: hyenas feeding on the carcass of a dead dinosaur

Levels 17-20.event: A fiery chariot that races across the sky
A valley where all the grass has died and the ground is littered with stumps and fallen tree trunks, all petrified
A friendly adventuring party of 1d6 + 1 characters of varying races, classes, and levels (average level 1d6 + 2). They share information about their recent travels.

Levels 1-4.event: An empty cave littered with bones

Levels 1-4.monsters: swarms of bats or 1d3 swarms of ravens

Levels 1-4.event: An old dwarf sitting on a stump, whittling a piece of wood
The corpse of an adventurer that carries an intact explorer’s pack and lies atop a longsword
A small cemetery containing 2d6 graves
A pile of droppings from a very large bird

Levels 1-4.monsters: gnoll pack lord with 1d3 giant hyenas
orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d8 + 2 orcs

Levels 5-10.monsters: goblin boss with 1d4 dire wolves and 2d6 goblins
gnoll pack lord with 2d4 giant hyenas

Levels 5-10.event: A 15-foot-tall stone statue of a dwarf warrior that has been tipped over on its side

Levels 5-10.monsters: orc Eye of Gruumsh with 2d6 + 3 orcs

Levels 5-10.event: A stone door set into the side of a steep hill, opening onto 15 feet of descending stairs that end at a cave-in
An abandoned wooden hut

Levels 11-16.monsters: hobgoblin captain with 1 hill giant and 4d10 hobgoblins

Levels 11-16.event: A stream of smoke emerging from a small chimney in the hillside
A mild earthquake that shakes the region for 1d20 seconds

Levels 11-16.monsters: dwarf miners (commoners), whistling as they march toward their mine
nobles with 1d4 scouts prospecting for gold

Levels 17-20.event: The white outline of an enormous horse carved into the side of a high hill
The scorched remains of 2d10 humanoids littering a hillside
A massive boulder partly buried in the earth as if it fell or was thrown there
The stub of an old stone tower jutting from the top of a hill

Levels 17-20.monsters: adult red dragons with 1d3 young red dragons

Levels 1-4.event: Stairs chiseled into the side of the mountain that climb 3d20 + 40 feet before ending abruptly

Levels 1-4.monsters: dwarf soldiers (guards) with 1d6 mules laden with iron ore

Levels 1-4.event: A small shrine dedicated to a lawful neutral god, perched on a stone outcropping
Enormous footprints left by a giant, which head into the mountain peaks
A sparkling stream of water spilling from a crevice

Levels 5-10.monsters: fissures venting steam that partially obscures a 20-foot cube above each fissure

Levels 5-10.event: A ravine blocked by a 100-foot-high wall, which has an opening in the center where a gate used to be
A distant mountain whose peak resembles a tooth

Levels 5-10.monsters: orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d6 orogs and 3d6 + 10 orcs

Levels 5-10.event: A row of 1d10 + 40 stakes upon which the bodies of kobolds, dwarves, or orcs are impaled

Levels 11-16.monsters: red dragon gliding through the sky above the highest mountaintops

Levels 11-16.event: Heavy snowfall that lasts for 1d6 hours

Levels 11-16.monsters: stone giants playing catch with a boulder a few hundred feet away

Levels 11-16.event: A wide crevasse, its depths shrouded in mist

Levels 17-20.event: A massive boat perched atop a mountain
A wooded valley haunted by secretive and reclusive elves who tell warily of their master: a mad wizard who lives in the heart of the valley
A waterfall hundreds of feet high that drops into a clear pool
A force of 100 dwarves (veterans) standing guard at a mountain pass, permitting no passage until a traveler pays 100 gp (if on foot) or 200 gp (if mounted)

Levels 1-4.monsters: mud huts partially sunken in murky water

Levels 1-4.event: The corpse of an adventurer tangled in the weeds. Looting the body turns up an explorer’s pack and perhaps (50% chance) a random common magic item.

Levels 1-4.monsters: swarms of rats or 1d6 + 2 swarms of ravens

Levels 1-4.event: A high-pitched shriek that lasts for 1d4 minutes
A foul stench bubbling up from brackish waters

Levels 1-4.monsters: lizardfolk shaman with 1d6 giant lizards and 2d10 lizardfolk
orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d3 orogs and 2d6 + 3 orcs

Levels 5-10.monsters: giant lizards or 2d4 giant poisonous snakes

Levels 5-10.event: Tainted water that exposes creatures that move through it to sight rot (see “Diseases” in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide)
A bloated humanoid corpse floating facedown in the water

Levels 5-10.monsters: lizardfolk shaman with 1d3 swarms of poisonous snakes and 1d8 + 2 lizardfolk

Levels 5-10.event: An altar partially sunk into the mud, devoted to a god that is part human and part frog

Levels 5-10.monsters: orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d3 ogres and 2d10 + 5 orcs

Levels 5-10.event: A torrential rain that lasts 1d6 minutes and puts out all unprotected flames within 1 mile

Levels 11-20.event: A large, spreading tree from which 2d6 armored knights hang by the neck
Fog that rolls across the terrain, making the area within 1d3 miles heavily obscured for 1d4 hours
An eerie, bat-headed idol almost completely covered by vines
The sound of drums beating several miles away

Levels 1-4.monsters: humans (tribal warriors) seeking the way to the surface, fleeing their Underdark oppressors

Levels 1-4.event: Orc graffiti on the walls, suggesting something rude about the mother of someone named Krusk
A rubble-strewn passage that appears to have been recently cleared after a cave-in
A faint tapping coming from inside a nearby wall
An abandoned miners’ camp spattered with blood and littered with the contents of 1d3 dungeoneer’s packs

Levels 1-4.monsters: hobgoblin captain with 1d4 half-ogres and 2d10 hobgoblins
orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d4 orogs and 2d8 orcs

Levels 1-4.event: A reeking puddle where slimy water has dripped from the ceiling

Levels 5-10.event: Luminescent fungi growing on the walls of a moist cave, filling it with dim light
A patch of mold that appears yellow when light is directed toward it

Levels 5-10.monsters: kuo-toa monitor with 1d4 kuo-toa whips and 1d8 + 1 kuo-toa

Levels 5-10.event: A merchant caravan consisting of 1 drow mage, 2 drow elite warriors, and 2d10 quaggoths

Levels 5-10.monsters: orc Eye of Gruumsh with 1d4 orogs and 2d10 + 3 orcs

Levels 11-16.event: A 100-foot-long ravine, 4d10 feet wide and 5d20 + 200 feet deep

Levels 11-16.monsters: Orc Eye of Gruumsh with 2d4 orogs and 2d10 orcs

Levels 11-16.event: A large cave containing 2d10 extraordinarily detailed statues of various creatures
A shrill scream followed by dark laughter
A ruined village that once belonged to deep gnomes. A search has a 50% chance of uncovering 1d3 potions of healing and a 25% chance of finding a random common magic item.

Levels 11-16.monsters: drow mages with 1d4 drow elite warriors
mind flayer arcanist with 1d6 + 1 mind flayers

Levels 17-20.event: A 30-foot-tall inverted black pyramid floating 1 inch above the floor in a large cave
A beautiful obsidian sculpture of a panther lying on the floor

Levels 17-20.monsters: drow mages with 1d6 drow elite warriors
spiders crawling on the walls of a web-filled cave

Levels 17-20.event: A large cave in which stands a 50-foot-tall idol of Blibdoolpoolp

Levels 1-4.monsters: corpses of drowned sailors tangled in kelp

Levels 1-4.event: A bed of enormous clams

Levels 1-4.monsters: pieces of corroded brass dinnerware littering the bottom

Levels 1-4.event: A school of silvery fish darting through the water

Levels 5-10.event: A sunken galleon with a 50% chance of a random treasure hoard inside (roll on the Treasure Hoard: Challenge 5-10 table in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide)
An abandoned bathysphere
An empty castle made from coral
An eerie statue of a squatting humanoid, with bat wings on its back and tentacles sprouting from its face

Levels 11-20.monsters: sahuagin baron with 1d4 sahuagin priestesses and 2d10 sahuagin

Levels 11-20.event: A ghost ship passing overhead, containing 2d6 + 10 ghosts
A 1-mile-radius sphere of effervescent water that allows air-breathing creatures to breathe water while in the sphere
A shimmering, blue-green portal to the Elemental Plane of Water

Levels 1-4.event: A peddler weighed down with a load of pots, pans, and other basic supplies
A wagon loaded with apples that has a broken wheel and holds up traffic

Levels 1-4.monsters: nobles on riding horses with an escort of 1d10 guards

Levels 1-4.event: Someone empties a chamber pot onto the street from a second-floor window
A doomsayer who preaches the end of the world from a street corner

Levels 5-10.monsters: swarms of bats and 1d6 swarms of rats

Levels 5-10.event: A talkative urchin, badgering passersby to serve as their guide through the community for a price of 1 sp
A noble shouts “Stop! Thief!” at a fleeing scoundrel (bandit)
An actor leans out from a second-story window to call to passersby, announcing a show
A fortune-teller reads cards for those who pay a price of 1 sp

Levels 11-16.monsters: bandit captain with 5d10 bandits, all on riding horses
knights on warhorses (one knight is a doppelganger)

Levels 11-16.event: A distant boom followed by a plume of smoke rising from the other side of the community
Street performers putting on a puppet show, involving two puppets beating each other with sticks to the amusement of the gathered crowd
A scruffy commoner that ducks into an alley to make a purchase from a suspicious-looking figure
Two farmers trading blows over the price of potatoes (50% chance for one farmer to be a retired assassin)

Levels 11-16.monsters: archmage speeding down the street on a riding horse, blasting 1d4 guards with spells

Levels 17-20.event: A witch (archmage) who zooms overhead on a broom of flying
A distraught parent who rushes up to people, begging for help for a child who fell into the sewer
An aggressive merchant who hawks wares to passersby, claiming to be the purveyor of the finest silks in all the land
A patrol of 2d10 guards marching up the street, searching for someone or something
